page.title: 04THORNTONHALL AND WATERFOOT
page.content: {Thorntonhall}is a{commuter}village.The housing varies from individual designs to large Victorian villas.The houses have spacious gardens and some even have swimming pools. All homes have a car and most have two or more.The roads do not have pavements. Large hedgerows and trees line the roads and exotic trees are found in some gardens.Thorntonhall has{no shops or {services}apart from a railway station. There is no bus service. { Waterfoot}is also a small{commuter village.The oldest buildings are found next to the Cart.These were once a mill but are now a farm store. Bungalows and villas line the main road.Behind these is a larger estate with smaller terraced and semi- detached houses.One small garage services cars.There is a single infrequent bus service.
